member.name: T:LeanCloud.Core.Internal.AVConfigExtensions
member.summary:
So here's the deal. We have a lot of internal APIs for AVObject, AVUser, etc.
These cannot be 'internal' anymore if we are fully modularizing things out, because they are no longer a part of the same library, especially as we create things like Installation inside push library.
So this class contains a bunch of extension methods that can live inside another namespace, which 'wrap' the intenral APIs that already exist.

member.name: T:LeanCloud.Core.Internal.PreserveAttribute
member.summary: A reimplementation of Xamarin's PreserveAttribute. This allows us to support AOT and linking for Xamarin platforms.

member.name: M:LeanCloud.Core.Internal.PreserveWrapperTypes.CreateWrapperTypes
member.summary:
Exists to ensure that generic types are AOT-compiled for the conversions we support. Any new value types that we add support for will need to be registered here. The method itself is never called, but by virtue of the Preserve attribute being set on the class, these types will be AOT-compiled.
This also applies to Unity.

member.name: T:LeanCloud.AVACL
member.summary: A AVACL is used to control which users and roles can access or modify a particular object. Each can have its own AVACL. You can grant read and write permissions separately to specific users, to groups of users that belong to roles, or you can grant permissions to "the public" so that, for example, any user could read a particular object but only a particular set of users could write to that object.

member.summary: Creates an ACL where only the provided user has access.
member.param: The only user that can read or write objects governed by this ACL.

member.name: T:LeanCloud.AVClient.Configuration.VersionInformation
member.summary:
In the event that you would like to use the LeanCloud SDK from a completely portable project, with no platform-specific library required, to get full access to all of our features available on LeanCloud.com (A/B testing, slow queries, etc.), you must set the values of this struct to be appropriate for your platform.
Any values set here will overwrite those that are automatically configured by any platform-specific migration library your app includes.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InternalServerError

member.summary: Error code indicating you tried to query with a datatype that doesn't support it, like exact matching an array or object.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InvalidClassName
member.summary: Error code indicating a missing or invalid classname. Classnames are case-sensitive. They must start with a letter, and a-zA-Z0-9_ are the only valid characters.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.MissingObjectId
member.summary: Error code indicating an unspecified object id.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InvalidKeyName
member.summary: Error code indicating an invalid key name. Keys are case-sensitive. They must start with a letter, and a-zA-Z0-9_ are the only valid characters.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InvalidPointer
member.summary: Error code indicating a malformed pointer. You should not see this unless you have been mucking about changing internal LeanCloud code.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InvalidJSON
member.summary: Error code indicating that badly formed JSON was received upstream. This either indicates you have done something unusual with modifying how things encode to JSON, or the network is failing badly.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.CommandUnavailable
member.summary: Error code indicating that the feature you tried to access is only available internally for testing purposes.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.IncorrectType
member.summary: Error code indicating that a field was set to an inconsistent type.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.InvalidChannelName
member.summary: Error code indicating an invalid channel name. A channel name is either an empty string (the broadcast channel) or contains only a-zA-Z0-9_ characters and starts with a letter.

member.name: F:LeanCloud.AVException.ErrorCode.PushMisconfigured

member.name: T:LeanCloud.AVObject
member.summary: The AVObject is a local representation of data that can be saved and retrieved from the LeanCloud cloud.

remarks.para: The basic workflow for creating new data is to construct a new AVObject, use the indexer to fill it with data, and then use SaveAsync() to persist to the database.
The basic workflow for accessing existing data is to use a AVQuery to specify which existing data to retrieve.

member.name: M:LeanCloud.AVQueryBase`2.Limit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of results that are returned. Setting a negative limit denotes retrieval without a limit. Chaining multiple limits results in the last limit specified being used. The default limit is 100, with a maximum of 1000 results being returned at a time.

member.returns: A new query with the additional constraint.
